atlantis.parsers.ordersparser¶

This module implements all classes needed to parse order files.

It defines a OrdersParser which will parse report lines and will call a OrdersConsumer with parser data. Classes willing to consume data parser by OrdersParser will have to implement OrdersConsumer interface.

Public classes in atlantis.parsers.ordersparser module:

OrdersConsumer Virtual class for OrdersParser consumer.
OrdersParser Atlantis orders parser.

OrdersConsumer¶

class atlantis.parsers.ordersparser.OrdersConsumer¶

Virtual class for OrdersParser consumer.

This is an interface for classes willing to receive data from the OrdersParser. Classes implementing this interface should overwrite their public methods.

OrdersParser¶

class atlantis.parsers.ordersparser.OrdersParser(consumer)¶

Atlantis orders parser.

OrdersParser is in charge of parsing an orders file, or the orders template part of an Atlantis PBEM report, and sends parsing result to its registered OrdersConsumer together with the original line, in case the OrdersConsumer needs it for description, as it happens with comments.

__init__(consumer)¶

Parser initializer.

Its only parameter is the consumer (must implmement OrdersConsumer interface) of the parsed report.

Parameter: consumer OrdersConsumer instance to which parsed elements will

be sent
parse(f)¶

Read orders from an open file and parse them

This method read lines from an open file. lines all passed to parse_line until the file ends.

Parameters: f Open file instance to be read

parse_line(line)¶

Parse an orders line.

Read line is always sent to the consumer before stripping them from its comments. The order line is parsed and its contents sent to the consumer.

Parameters: line Line being parsed

static tokenize(line)¶

Tokenize a line

Splits a line into its tokens. In Atlantis tokens are defined by: - Double quotes: everything included between a pair of double quotes is a token, no matter which characters are in it. - Comments: comments is anything after a semi-colon ;. Comments suffer no longer tokenization, they’re a single token - Permanent mark: the at sign @ as the first not blank is interpreted as a permanent mark, and anything following it will be included in next turn orders template. - Spaces: tokens are separated by spaces.

Tokenize returns a tuple with the following elements: list of tokens, permanent flag (True or False), comment string.

Parameters: line The line to be tokenized

Returns: A three elements tuple with the list of tokens, the permanent flag and the commend string

Raises: SyntaxError If an error is found (like unmatched quotes)
